page.title: 06LOCAL FARMS
page.content: Mr Groves farms 18 acres in Barling. He has lived here all his life. He grows potatoes, cabbages and carrots. He keeps chickens. These are kept in a shed in small wire cages. He buys the chicks when they are one week old.He sells produce from his van. Mr Pavelin farms 40 acres. He has 3 ponies and 2 ducks.He shares the farm with his brother.They grow peas,oil seed rape and wheat. Mr Rayner has the largest farm in our area. Altogether he has 1800 acres.He has one worker for every 100 acres. The men start work at 7.30am in the morning and finish at 5pm.He grows winter wheat, winter barley, potatoes and oil seed rape.This year he is growing winter wheat on most of his land.The main nuisance is from rabbits.
